SEARCH

Class SnakeGameLogic

java.lang.Object
SnakeGameLogic
public class SnakeGameLogic extends Object
The SnakeGameLogic class contains the core logic for the Snake game. It manages the game state, including the positions of the snakes, food, and scores.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static enum 
    SnakeGameLogic.Direction
    Represents the direction in which the snake is moving.
    static class 
    SnakeGameLogic.Point
    Represents a point on the game board with x and y coordinates.

  • Method Details

    • updateSettings

      public void updateSettings(int width, int height, boolean isBorderless, javafx.scene.paint.Color snake1Color, javafx.scene.paint.Color snake2Color, javafx.scene.paint.Color foodColor, javafx.scene.paint.Color backgroundColor, boolean isTwoPlayerMode, double gameSpeed)
      Updates the game settings with the specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      width - the width of the game board
      height - the height of the game board
      isBorderless - whether the game is in borderless mode
      snake1Color - the color of snake 1
      snake2Color - the color of snake 2
      foodColor - the color of the food
      backgroundColor - the background color of the game board
      isTwoPlayerMode - whether the game is in two-player mode
      gameSpeed - the speed of the game

    • resetGame

      public void resetGame()
      Resets the game state, including the positions of the snakes and food. Resets scores and directions for both snakes.

    • run

      public void run()
      Updates the game state for each frame of the game loop. Handles snake movement and collision detection.

    • moveSnake

      private void moveSnake(List<SnakeGameLogic.Point> snake, SnakeGameLogic.Direction direction)
      Moves the specified snake in the current direction and handles collisions and food consumption.
      Parameters:
      snake - the list of points representing the snake's body
      direction - the direction in which the snake is moving

    • checkCollisions

      private void checkCollisions(List<SnakeGameLogic.Point> snake)
      Checks for collisions between the specified snake and the game boundaries or itself.
      Parameters:
      snake - the list of points representing the snake's body

    • checkInterSnakeCollisions

      private void checkInterSnakeCollisions()
      Checks for collisions between the two snakes in two-player mode.

    • spawnFood

      private void spawnFood()
      Spawns food at a random location on the game board. Ensures that food does not spawn on the snakes' bodies.

    • updateDirection

      public void updateDirection(javafx.scene.input.KeyCode code)
      Updates the direction of the snake based on the player's input, with a delay to prevent rapid changes.
      Parameters:
      code - the key code of the player's input

    • getWidth

      public int getWidth()
      Gets the width of the game board.

      Checks if the game is in borderless mode.
      Returns:
      true if the game is in borderless mode, false otherwise

      public boolean isTwoPlayerMode()
      Checks if the game is in two-player mode.
      Returns:
      true if the game is in two-player mode, false otherwise
